title: Grow Stunning Flowers at Home: Hydroponic Magic!

tasks.task: Set up a hydroponic flower farming system
subtasks: Choose a hydroponic system (Kratky, Deepwater Culture, or Tower Systems)
Select easy-to-grow flowers (like marigolds and petunias)
Obtain the necessary supplies (lighting, nutrients, water)
Monitor and maintain water levels
Regularly check pH levels
Ensure proper airflow around the plants

tasks.task: Start a hydroponic flower garden
subtasks: Prepare the chosen hydroponic system (assembling the selected system)
Plant the selected flowers in the system
Provide essential care (lighting, feeding, watering)
Regularly monitor plant health and adjust care as needed
Avoid common mistakes (overwatering, pH imbalances)

tasks.task: Set up a hydroponic flower farming system

tasks.task: Start a hydroponic flower garden
subtasks: Follow the setup steps mentioned above

tasks.task: The next MAINTASK would be "Start a hydroponic flower garden" once set up. Or maybe combine everything into one task called "Start a hydroponic flower farming venture," which includes choosing the system, flowers, getting supplies, setting it up, planting, and taking care of the plants.
Set up a hydroponic flower farming system
Manage a hydroponic flower garden (with subtasks: planting, caring, monitoring, etc.)
Alternatively, "Start a hydroponic flower garden" as the MAINTASK would include all steps from selecting to ongoing care. But then it's more of a project management task.
Set up a hydroponic flower system
Start and manage a hydroponic flower garden

But this would end up with a lot of overlapping. Alternatively, consider the setup is a one-time process (planning and construction), and gardening is the recurring activity. So need to have a setup task (MAINTASK) and ongoing management (MAINTASK).

Maintain hydroponic flower garden

tasks.task: Set up a hydroponic flower system.
Start maintaining your hydroponic flower garden.
If this is the case, answer will contain 2 MAINTASKs.

The video does not mention step-by-step. But according to the script, it's clear that the first 4 steps (choosing, selecting, getting, setting up) are setup. Planting is part of setup. Then starting the garden is ongoing care (monitoring and maintaining). So 2 MAINTASKs.
Set up a hydroponic flower system (Choose system, select flowers, get supplies, assemble, plant)
Start and care for your hydroponic flower garden (Monitor water levels, pH, airflow)
setup until you have the plants established, and then continuous care.
